bibl.title: Letter from Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon to Philip Showalter Hench, August 29, 1950

div1.p: Rodriguez Leon has learned from her husband that he was able to retrieve her father's documents from the post office.

div1.head: Letter from Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon to Philip Showalter Hench, August 29, 1950
div1.opener:
File Y F
Finca Gracia de Dios,
???, Cuba.
August 29, 1950
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
102-110 Second Ave, S.W.
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have just received a telegram from my
husband saying that he was able to get the
documents out of the P. O. this morning. I
was unable to get them last Friday from
the customs, where they were being held
for inspection. During the summer they
do not open on Saturday so Pancho prom-
ised to see about it today. Evidently, he
has been successful.

Thank you kindly for your diligence
in sending the papers, and for the gift of
the tin box. I shall be home next week
and I am sure I will find everything
in order. I shall try to get copies- if
they print them of the lectures which are
beginning on the 11 of September.

I am spending a week's vacation on a
cattle ranch that used to belong to my
grandmother. It is delightful not to
hear the telephone ring for a few days.
Remind me to your wife. Again thank
you for the promptness with which you
responded to my request.
